With the potential for inclement weather in our forecast, we would like to remind you of our process for providing you information regarding school delays or closures. Our priority is always student and staff safety.

Our transportation staff starts checking road conditions by 5:00 AM. We have staff members living throughout the district that provide us with information on the road conditions in their area. We try to post any changes in our schedule by 5:30 AM.

We will only send out a notification via School Messenger if we are going to make any adjustments to our schedule, such as having buses on snow routes, a two-hour delay or a school cancellation. Notifications will also go out through Flash Alert and will be posted here on Facebook as well. Snow routes are listed on the district webpage under the transportation department.

In the event school is cancelled, all activities for that day are cancelled as well.

Our other two five-member teams took 23rd and 35th out of 51 teams.

This is an active investigation and we will provide periodic updates when it is appropriate to release information.

The Boys and Girls Club and Rick Franklin are the chief sponsors of this event, and it has been thrilling to see so many people come together in support of our students. The Expo will take place all day on Friday near the Santiam Travel Station.

BUDGET COMMITTEE VACANCIES ANNOUNCED

The Lebanon Community School District has announced two position vacancies for the Budget Committee and is accepting applications. Candidates must currently reside in the District, must not be an officer or employee of the District, and must be qualified voters of the District. The selected candidates will serve for a three-year term expiring June 30, 2019.

Applications can be found on the District website at www.lebanon.k12.or.us or can be picked up at the LCSD Business Office at 485 S. 5th Street, Lebanon, Oregon 97355. Interviews for eligible candidates will be held at the School Board Meeting on Thursday, February 9, 2017, at 6:00 PM at Hamilton Creek School. Candidates should plan to attend the Board Meeting. The appointment of the positions will be made during the same Board Meeting, with a Budget Meeting immediately following.

For further information or questions, please contact Linda Darling, 541-451-8511, ext. 233.

School Closed on Friday, December 16

Schools and all offices will be closed tomorrow, December 16. Though it stopped snowing today and major roads were clear of snow by this afternoon, the temperature never got above freezing, and the roads are still very wet. School parking lots are covered in snow for the most part as well. It is predicted to hit 25 degrees tonight so all of that moisture is going to freeze solid. In all likelihood, the roads will be even more dangerous tomorrow morning than they were today.

Enjoy the holidays and see you next year!
